duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan and organize care to meet individual patient needs and ensure appropriate clinical resource utilization.
Diagnose illnesses, physical conditions, and perform therapeutic, corrective, and prescriptive measures for inpatient and outpatient populations.
Assist in the preparation, implementation, and evaluation of research protocols.
Collaborate with nursing and other disciplines in the development and implementation of clinical studies.
Use evidence-based health care literature to advise and support appropriate practice changes.
Participate in the development and monitoring of patient outcomes for quality and performance improvement.
Serve as a clinical expert and resource for the education of peers and other health professionals.
Maintain current expertise in area of practice and promote professional growth and development.
Evaluate treatment and health care plans for effectiveness and modify per clinical standards and practice protocols.
Prescribe medical equipment, devices, physical and occupational therapy, and home health services per practice protocol.
Prescribe in-patient and discharge medications according to New York State law.
Formulate the plan of care based on expected goals of care with the attending physician and patient/family.
Order customary laboratory, radiological, and diagnostic studies per practice protocols and differentiate between normal/abnormal findings.
Perform complete health history, physical examination, and psychosocial assessment of patients.
Facilitate continuity of care across the continuum of services and provide consultation about the therapeutic regimen.
Work collaboratively with the interdisciplinary team to develop and implement the therapeutic plan of care for patients.
Adhere to the ACHD accreditation requirements with an Administrative component.

education_certification.credential: Master's Degree in Nursing, current registration as Professional Nurse in New York, and Registration as Nurse Practitioner in New York. Board Certification from a specialty organization that certifies Nurse Practitioners in a clinical area of practice. ACLS, PALS, NRP Provider, NALS per delineation of privileges.
